void AddLoopTag (cpstr T, bool Remove=true)
 Adds tag to the loop. The tag is appended to the list of existing tags. The order of tags cannot be changed.
void AddString (cpstr S, bool NonBlankOnly=false)
 Sets string value at current loop position. When mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] functions use internal loop pointer. When category is created or cleared (by using mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( T,true )) the pointer is set to 0th row and 0th column (tag). After each call to mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] function, internal pointer advances to next column (tag), and wraps over to next row, 0th tag, if list of tags is exhausted. Any remaining fields in last row will be populated with "data not given" value.

MMCIF_ITEM GetCategoryID ()
 Returns category type MMCIF_Loop.
void Optimize ()
 Optimizes loop for RAM and data access speed. Optimized data structures take less RAM and their indexes are sorted for quicker access. Sorting is done automatically as new data is added to the category. If the structure is edited (fields/data removed), it may need optimization and re-sorting for efficiency.

The sorting preserves the order of actual appearance of tags and rows in mmCIF file. If a loop is created programmatically, the order of tags and rows in mmCIF file will be the same as order of adding them to the loop.
bool WriteMMCIFLoop (cpstr FName, io::GZ_MODE gzipMode=io::GZM_CHECK)
 Writes loop data in mmCIF format into file.
void WriteMMCIF (io::RFile f)
 Writes loop data into given file.
void Copy (PCategory Loop)
 Deep copy of loops. Deep copy duplicates all data and memory allocations, producing a genuine clone of the original. Only deep copy should be used for copying MMDB objects, a mere assignment operator will fail you.

Detailed Description

mmcif::Loop represents mmCIF's "loop" category, which keeps rows of data values associated with tags.

mmCIF's "loop" category has the following form: 

    loop_
    _loop_name.tag0   value0
    _loop_name.tag1   value1
    ...........
    _loop_name.tagN   valueN
    value00 value10 ... valueN0
    value01 value11 ... valueN1
    ...........
    value0M value1M ... valueNM

mmcif::Loop represents this construct by keeping category name ("_loop_name") and associated lists of tags ("tag0,tag1...tagN") and data vectors ("[value00...value0M],[value10...value1M]...[valueN0...valueNM]").

The loop object is created automatically when an mmCIF file is read, or it may be created programatically and then pushed into file.

Access to data is provided via tags and data indexes. Internally, all values are kept as character fields, and it is only on the retrieval stage that they are converted to other data types (integers, floats or strings). If conversion is not possible, an error code is returned by the corresponding functions, which should be checked by the application.

The following code gives an example of creating mmCIF loop category and populating it with data: 

    mmcif::Loop loop;
    char       S[100];
    int        i;

      // Specify loop name:
      loop.SetCategoryName ( "_sample_loop" );

      // Create loop structure, i.e., list of tags first:
      loop.AddLoopTag ( "id"    );
      loop.AddLoopTag ( "name"  );
      loop.AddLoopTag ( "value" );

      // Now populate it with data. This my be done in 2 ways.
      // Here is how you write loop data in stream fashion,
      // value-after-value:
      for (i=0;i<3;i++)  {
        loop.AddInteger ( i );
        sprintf ( S,"1st_way-%i",i );
        loop.AddString ( S );
        loop.AddReal ( 2.5*(i+1) );
      }

      // Here is how you populate loop data using direct-access
      // functions:
      for (i=3;i<6;i++)  {
        loop.PutReal ( 2.5*(i+1),"value",i );
        loop.PutInteger ( i,"id" );
        sprintf ( S,"2nd way: %i",i );
        loop.PutString ( S,"name" );
      }

      loop.WriteMMCIFLoop ( "sample_loop.cif" );

The resulting file sample_loop.cif will contain:

    loop_
    _sample_loop.id
    _sample_loop.name
    _sample_loop.value
    0   1st_way-0     2.5
    1   1st_way-1     5.0
    2   1st_way-2     7.5
    3   "2nd way: 3"  10.0
    4   "2nd way: 4"  12.5
    5   "2nd way: 5"  15.0

See general principles of working with mmCIF files and mmCIF hierarchies, as well as some code samples, in Section "mmcif_handler".

Member Function Documentation

void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::AddInteger ( int  I )

Sets integer value at current loop position in given format. When mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] functions use internal loop pointer. When category is created or cleared (by using mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( T,true )) the pointer is set to 0th row and 0th column (tag). After each call to mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] function, internal pointer advances to next column (tag), and wraps over to next row, 0th tag, if list of tags is exhausted. Any remaining fields in last row will be populated with "data not given" value.

Parameters:
[in]Iinteger number with value to be set.
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( cpstr  T,
bool  Remove = true 
)

Adds tag to the loop. The tag is appended to the list of existing tags. The order of tags cannot be changed.

Parameters:
[in]Ttag name
[in]Removeflag to remove all fields in the loop.
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::AddNoData ( int  NoDataType )

Sets "data not given" or "data not available" at current loop position. When mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] functions use internal loop pointer. When category is created or cleared (by using mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( T,true )) the pointer is set to 0th row and 0th column (tag). After each call to mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] function, internal pointer advances to next column (tag), and wraps over to next row, 0th tag, if list of tags is exhausted. Any remaining fields in last row will be populated with "data not given" value.

Parameters:
[in]NoDataTypeinteger key specifying which type of data absence should be set as a value:

  • CIF_NODATA_DOT for "data not given"
  • CIF_NODATA_QUESTION for "data not available"

int  prec = 8 
)

When category is created or cleared (by using mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( T,true )) the pointer is set to 0th row and 0th column (tag). After each call to mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] function, internal pointer advances to next column (tag), and wraps over to next row, 0th tag, if list of tags is exhausted. Any remaining fields in last row will be populated with "data not given" value.

Parameters:
[in]Rreal number with value to be set.

Sets float-point value at current loop position in given format. When mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] functions use internal loop pointer. When category is created or cleared (by using mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( T,true )) the pointer is set to 0th row and 0th column (tag). After each call to mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] function, internal pointer advances to next column (tag), and wraps over to next row, 0th tag, if list of tags is exhausted. void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::AddString ( cpstr  S,
bool  NonBlankOnly = false 
)

Sets string value at current loop position. When mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] functions use internal loop pointer. When category is created or cleared (by using mmcif::Loop::AddLoopTag ( T,true )) the pointer is set to 0th row and 0th column (tag). After each call to mmcif::Loop::Add[Data] function, internal pointer advances to next column (tag), and wraps over to next row, 0th tag, if list of tags is exhausted. Any remaining fields in last row will be populated with "data not given" value.

Parameters:
[in]Scharacter string with value to be set. If S==NULL, the "data not given" value will be set. If S=="" (empty string), the "data not available" value is stored.
[in]NonBlankOnlyflag to treat white-space-only strings:

  • false: set as is
  • true: set "data not available" value instead.
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::Copy ( PCategory  Loop ) [virtual]

Deep copy of loops. Deep copy duplicates all data and memory allocations, producing a genuine clone of the original. Only deep copy should be used for copying MMDB objects, a mere assignment operator will fail you.

Parameters:
[in]Loopa pointer to mmcif::Loop, the content of which is copied into 'this' loop.

Reimplemented from mmdb::mmcif::Category.

cpstr  TName,
int  nrow,
int &  RC 
)

Copies value, associated with given tag, in the given row, into specified destination as an integer number.

Parameters:
[out]Ireference to integer number to accept the value
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]nrowrow number (0...GetLoopLength()-1)
[out]RCreturn code:

  • CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
  • CIFRC_WrongIndex: row is not found
  • CIFRC_NoField: value is not found
  • CIFRC_Ok: success.
Remarks:
Destination I is set 0 if RC!=CIFRC_Ok.

pstr mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetField ( int  rowNo,
int  tagNo 
)

Returns string pointer on the field corresponding to tag in the specified position, in the specified row. Tag positions are defined by the order of their appearance in mmCIF file (if loop was read from a file), or by the order of their addition to the loop (if loop was created programmatically).

Parameters:
[in]rowNorow number (0...GetLoopLength()-1)
[in]tagNotag number (0...GetNofTags()-1)
Returns:
NULL: tag or row do not exist
CIF_NODATA_DOT_FIELD the field contains "data not given" value
CIF_NODATA_QUESTION_FIELD the field contains "data not available" value
not NULL: string value of the field
Remarks:
Never try to dispose memory pointed by the return value, or your program will crash.
int mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetInteger ( int &  I,
cpstr  TName,
int  nrow,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches value, corresponding to the given tag, in the given row, as an integer number.

Parameters:
[out]Ireference to integer number to accept the value. In case of failure, R returns zero.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]nrowrow number (0...GetLoopLength()-1)
[in]Removeflag to remove the field from the loop after it is read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_WrongIndex: row not found
CIFRC_NoField: field is not found
CIFRC_WrongFormat: value is not a real or integer number.
CIFRC_NoData: value is either "data not available" or "data not given".
CIFRC_Ok: success.
int mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetIVector ( ivector &  I,
cpstr  TName,
int  i1 = 0,
int  i2 = MaxInt4,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches set of values, corresponding to the given tag, in the given range of rows, as a vector of integer numbers.

Parameters:
[out]Ireference to float-point vector to accept the values. if I==NULL , the vector will be allocated with starting index of i1.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]i1minimum row number to fetch, the actual index will be calculated as max(0,min(i1,i2))
[in]i2maximum row number to fetch, the actual index will be calculated as min(GetLoopLength()-1,max(i1,i2))
[in]Removeflag to remove fetched fields from the loop after they are read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_WrongIndex: invalid range of rows
CIFRC_Ok: success.

For safe use, I should be pre-allocated by calling process. Only elements I[i1] to I[i2] will contain fetched data, others remain untouched. The calling process is responsible for the disposal of I. See example in mmcif::Loop::GetRVector documentation for details.

Returns current length of the loop (i.e. the number of rows).

Returns:
number of data rows in the loop.

int mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetRVector ( rvector &  R,
cpstr  TName,
int  i1 = 0,
int  i2 = MaxInt4,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches set of values, corresponding to the given tag, in the given range of rows, as a vector of float-point numbers.

Parameters:
[out]Rreference to float-point vector to accept the values. if R==NULL , the vector will be allocated with starting index of i1.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]i1minimum row number to fetch, the actual index will be calculated as max(0,min(i1,i2))
[in]i2maximum row number to fetch, the actual index will be calculated as min(GetLoopLength()-1,max(i1,i2))
[in]Removeflag to remove fetched fields from the loop after they are read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_WrongIndex: invalid range of rows
CIFRC_Ok: success.

For safe use, R should be pre-allocated by calling process. Only elements R[i1] to R[i2] will contain fetched data, others remain untouched. The calling process is responsible for the disposal of R. Example: 

 mmcif::Loop loop;
 rvector    R;  // equivalent to realtype *R
 int        i,i1,i2,rc,n;

    // ... get loop data

    n  = loop.GetLoopLength();
    i1 = 5;  i2 = n - 5;  // could be wrong!

    //  allocate a vector of real numbers
    GetVectorMemory ( R,n,0 );  // "0" for starting index
    // no need to initiaize unless required for the
    // application

    rc = loop.GetRVector ( R,"value",i1,i2 );
    printf ( " Fetched with return code rc=%i\n",rc );
        // you may want a more thorough treatment of
        // the return code here
    for (i=i1;i<=i2;i++)
      printf ( " value[%4i] = %15.7g\n",i,R[i] );

    //  R[] may be re-used for as many fetches as necessary
    //  without cleaning or disposals

    //  dispose of the vector
    FreeVectorMemory ( R,0 );  // "0" for starting index
int mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetString ( pstr &  S,
cpstr  TName,
int  nrow,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches value, corresponding to the given tag, in the given row, as a string.

Parameters:
[out]Spointer to string, which will point to newly allocated character string, containing value associated with tag TName and row nrow. If tag, row or value is not found, or if value corresponds to mmCIF's "data not given" or "data not available", S returns NULL.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]nrowrow number (0...GetLoopLength()-1)
[in]Removeflag to remove the field from structure after it is read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_WrongIndex: row is not found
CIFRC_NoField: value is not found
CIFRC_Ok: success. If S returns NULL, then the value corresponds to either "data not available" or "data not given".
Remarks:
If S!=NULL at time of call, the function will try to dispose the string it points on. This allows a slick re-use of the same pointer in consequitive calls. This also means that one should never pass unallocated pointer to this function. Safe use assumes the following patern: 
  mmcif::Loop mmCIFLoop;
  pstr S;  // this is merely "char *S"
  int  rc;

    S  = NULL; // null pointer before first use
    rc = mmCIFLoop.GetString ( S,"id",1 );
    if (rc)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not found" );
    if (!S)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not given or not available" );
    printf ( " rc=%i, S='%s'\n",rc,S );

    rc = mmCIFLoop.GetString ( S,"property",0 );
    if (rc)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not found" );
    if (!S)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not given or not available" );
    printf ( " rc=%i, S='%s'\n",rc,S );

    // etc etc etc

    delete[] S;  // application is responsible for final
                 // disposal of memory
pstr mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetString ( cpstr  TName,
int  nrow,
int &  RC 
)

Returns pointer to value associated with given tag, in the given row of the loop.

Parameters:
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]nrowrow number (0...GetLoopLength()-1)
[out]RCreturn code:

  • CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
  • CIFRC_WrongIndex: row is not found
  • CIFRC_NoField: value is not found
  • CIFRC_Ok: success. If function returns NULL, then the value corresponds to either "data not available" or "data not given".
Returns:
NULL: either tag, row or value is not found, or the value is "data not available" or "data not given". Read return code RC in order to interpret NULL return.
not NULL: pointer (char *) to value associated with TName.
Remarks:
Never try to dispose memory pointed by the return value, or your program will crash.
int mmdb::mmcif::Loop::GetSVector ( psvector &  S,
cpstr  TName,
int  i1 = 0,
int  i2 = MaxInt4,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches set of values, corresponding to the given tag, in the given range of rows, as a vector of strings.

Parameters:
[out]Sreference to string vector to accept the values. if S==NULL , the vector will be allocated with starting index of i1.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]i1minimum row number to fetch, the actual index will be calculated as max(0,min(i1,i2))
[in]i2maximum row number to fetch, the actual index will be calculated as min(GetLoopLength()-1,max(i1,i2))
[in]Removeflag to remove fetched fields from the loop after they are read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_WrongIndex: invalid range of rows
CIFRC_Ok: success.

For safe use, S should be pre-allocated by calling process. Only elements S[i1] to S[i2] will contain fetched data, others remain untouched. The calling process is responsible for the disposal of S. Example: 

 mmcif::Loop loop;
 psvector   S;  // equivalent to char **S
 int        i,i1,i2,rc,n;

    // ... get loop data

    n  = loop.GetLoopLength();
    i1 = 5;  i2 = n - 5;  // could be wrong!

    //  allocate vector of strings
    GetVectorMemory ( S,n,0 );  // "0" for starting index
    for (i=0;i<n;i++)
      S[i] = NULL;  // initialize NULL string pointers

    loop.GetSVector ( S,"name",i1,i2 );
    printf ( " Fetched with return code rc=%i\n",rc );
        // you may want a more thorough treatment of
        // the return code here
    for (i=i1;i<=i2;i++)
      if (S[i])  printf ( " %4i. name='%s'\n",i,S[i] );
           else  printf ( " %4i. name is not available\n",i );

    //  S[] may be re-used for as many fetches as necessary
    //  without cleaning or disposals

    //  dispose of vector of strings
    for (i=0;i<n;i++)
      if (S[i])  delete[] S[i];
    FreeVectorMemory ( S,0 );  // "0" for starting index
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::InitLoop (  ) [protected]
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::Optimize (  ) [virtual]

Optimizes loop for RAM and data access speed. Optimized data structures take less RAM and their indexes are sorted for quicker access. Sorting is done automatically as new data is added to the category. If the structure is edited (fields/data removed), it may need optimization and re-sorting for efficiency.

The sorting preserves the order of actual appearance of tags and rows in mmCIF file. If a loop is created programmatically, the order of tags and rows in mmCIF file will be the same as order of adding them to the loop.

Reimplemented from mmdb::mmcif::Category.

void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::PutInteger ( int  I,
cpstr  T,
int  nrow 
)

Sets integer value for given tag.

Parameters:
[in]Iinteger number with value to be set.
[in]Tcharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added, and all data in the loop will be reindexed accordingly.
[in]nrowrow number. If the row does not exist then it will be created, along with all other rows between GetLoopLength()-1 and nrow as necessary. All newly created fields will be initialised with "data not given" value.
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::PutIVector ( ivector  I,
cpstr  T,
int  i1,
int  i2 
)

Sets a set of integer values for the given tag and range of rows.

Parameters:
[in]Ivector of integers to store in the loop
[in]Tcharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added, and all data in the loop will be reindexed accordingly.
[in]i1minimum data index in S to set in the loop
[in]i2maximum data index in S to set in the loop.

The data will be set in rows i1 to i2 (inclusive) in the loop. If range [i1,i2] is not contained in the loop, all missing rows will be created and initialised to "data not given" value.

  • CIF_NODATA_QUESTION for "data not available"
[in]Tcharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added, and all data in the loop will be reindexed accordingly.
[in]nrowrow number. If the row does not exist then it will be created, along with all other rows between GetLoopLength()-1 and nrow as necessary. All newly created fields will be initialised with "data not given" value.

void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::PutString ( cpstr  S,
cpstr  T,
int  nrow 
)

Sets string value for given tag and row.

Parameters:
[in]Scharacter string with value to be set. If S==NULL, the "data not given" value will be set. If S=="" (empty string), the "data not available" value is stored.
[in]Tcharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added, and all data in the loop will be reindexed accordingly.
[in]nrowrow number. If the row does not exist then it will be created, along with all other rows between GetLoopLength()-1 and nrow as necessary. All newly created fields will be initialised with "data not given" value.
void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::PutSVector ( psvector  S,
cpstr  T,
int  i1,
int  i2 
)

Sets a set of string values for the given tag and range of rows.

Parameters:
[in]Sstring vector with values to store in the loop
[in]Tcharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added, and all data in the loop will be reindexed accordingly.
[in]i1minimum data index in S to set in the loop
[in]i2maximum data index in S to set in the loop.

The data will be set in rows i1 to i2 (inclusive) in the loop. If range [i1,i2] is not contained in the loop, all missing rows will be created and initialised to "data not given" value. Example: 

 mmcif::Loop loop("_sample_loop");
 pstr       S[100];
 int        i;

    //  initialize vector of strings
    for (i=0;i<100;i++)  {
      S[i] = new char[20];
      sprintf ( S[i],"value i=%i",i );
    }

    //  put data in loop
    loop.PutSVector ( S,"made_up_string_value",0,99 );

    //  dispose of vector of strings
    for (i=0;i<100;i++)
      if (S[i])  delete[] S[i];

void mmdb::mmcif::Loop::WriteMMCIF ( io::RFile  f ) [virtual]

Writes loop data into given file.

Parameters:
freference to MMDB's file class. The file should be opened and closed by application.
Remarks:
There is a very limited use of this function on application level. It is primarily used by mmcif::Data class.

Reimplemented from mmdb::mmcif::Category.

bool mmdb::mmcif::Loop::WriteMMCIFLoop ( cpstr  FName,
io::GZ_MODE  gzipMode = io::GZM_CHECK 
)

Writes loop data in mmCIF format into file.

Parameters:
[in]FNamecharacter string with file name.
[in]gzipModeflag to controll compression of files:

  • GZM_NONE: do not compress
  • GZM_CHECK: check file name suffix and compress (or not) accordingly
  • GZM_ENFORCE_GZIP: force gzip compression despite suffix
  • GZM_ENFORCE_COMPRESS: force using compress despite suffix
Returns:
true: success
false: can not open file for writing.
Remarks:
This function does not create a valid mmCIF file as "data_XXX" record will be missing. It may be used for debugging though.
